comment._content: U.S. Army Pacific Commander, Hawaiian Department BG John P. Wisser 1915-1916 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Army_Pacific

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: And from the Fort Shafter website: "Brigadier General John P. Wisser, Commanding General, Hawaiian Department, 6 November 1915 – 12 May 1916 and 14 September 1917 – 19 May 1918" ( ref. www.usarpac.army.mil/histtr04.html ) He is wearing a form of Mess Dress Uniform in this photograph - the most elaborate evening wear uniform. The color of his uniform lapels is dictated by his branch of service, in Wisser's case red for artillery I believe. Apparently he was on the scene at the assassination of President McKinley: books.google.com.au/books?id=dP3wKklF8-4C&lpg=PA64&am... John P. Wisser&pg=PA64#v=onepage&q=&f=false and a prolific author in military sciences with 7 titles in the LOC online catalogue Wisser, John P. (John Philip), 1852-1927 : catalog.loc.gov/cgi-bin/Pwebrecon.cgi?hd=1,1&Search_A... P. Wisser&Search_Code=NAME@&CNT=100&PID=dh-ZjF-owuUmk8dht5rSz-C31lZa&HIST=0&SEQ=20090815023136&SID=1

comment._content: the eyes, the piercing eyes.. seriously, these old portraits are fascinating. good on the commenters for identifying the people in them too. -- Seen on your photo stream. (?)
